snippet.title: Sexual misconduct, hazing alleged at Marquette fraternities | University issues official warnings to 3 fraternities
snippet.description: The university issued warnings to the three fraternities where sexual misconduct was alleged, and one also was warned for a hazing incident. Marquette University's Division of Student Affairs has issued official warnings to three fraternities following allegations of sexual misconduct and hazing. snippet.description: Nick D'Agosto, a 2002 Marquette University graduate, has been named one of the co-stars of "How I Met Your Father." snippet.title: On Tap Today: Paul McComas 'Unplugged'
snippet.description: Twelve years ago, Milwaukee native Paul McComas wrote the book "Unplugged," about a young musician and rape survivor trying to overcome depression and come to terms with her troubled childhood. snippet.title: Marquette University names new vice president for advancement
snippet.description: Marquette University has named Michael VanDerhoef as its new vice president for university advancement, a position that leads the university’s fund-raising efforts. snippet.title: Marquette University students ambivalent, excited about new president
snippet.description: Campus reactions to the first lay president in Marquette University’s 133-year history ranged from ambivalence to excitement Wednesday. snippet.title: Former Marquette University leader Pilarz named head of prep school
snippet.description: Father Scott R. Pilarz, who unexpectedly resigned last fall as president of Marquette University, will start a new job July 1 leading Georgetown Preparatory School. snippet.title: Lovell to lead Marquette University
snippet.description: Lovell will replace Father Scott R. Pilarz, who unexpectedly announced his resignation in September after two years on the job.
